title: Ekko is a problem child
body:
i'm sorry but Ekko, his ult is too strong.
This isnt coming from me playing against him, its from playing as him. The ratios on his ult, are far too high.
Literally exploded teams twice with it.
like the 1st time, i hovered over it to see how much damage it could do, this is at the 30+ minute mark, it was around 1300 total. So i used it
and pretty much instantly got a quadra kill and won the game for my team.
I jsut used it again now, and a took a full health ziggs, down to zero in 1 move. I just feel that its a bit unfair to use his ult when it does 1500+ damage without any charge up time. I mean Nunu's ult doe a lot, but he needs to charge that shit 1st.

Yeh i feel like i am playing him relatively well, he is extremely fun to play as and to watch in general, his moves seem so crisp and there is a lot of trickery that can go along with it, seriously he jukes better than {{champion:7}} 
but i feel he is definately on the strong side, if just nerfing his ult ratios would do it then thats great!

replies.body:
> Ekko is a problem child 

"We have finally made a champ whose lore and gameplay are matching _exactly _ !! HURAAAY"
 - Riot.

~~I dunno, Riven's a pretty broken individual lorewise and gameplay-wise...~~

Honestly she's annoying but I don't know if I'd say she's overpowered.

Thank you for not straight up saying she's op :D
She's very strong in the right hands, aka animation cancelling. Without that, she's no problem.
Everything is a problem at Bronze/ Silver elo.
so a 1 click quadra kill is fine then?

FOOL! Only trash Karthus' get quadras, real Karthus mains get penta ults.

> [{quoted}](name=Anotherherolost,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=000300000002,timestamp=2015-05-29T17:11:46.473+0000)
>
> Karthus seems okay with it

ekko's has more than double the AP scaling and less than half the cooldown; karthus gives you time to prepare for the damage, ekko only shows you WHERE he can ult

You act like this is an uncommon occurrence

{{champion:55}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:30}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:32}} 

This isn't some unique trait that *only* Ekko has.  Lots of champions have high teamfight AOE damage.  To hit people with his ult, Ekko is blowing his most reliable escape and putting himself in a very dangerous position.  I think it's a reasonable tradeoff, especially considering you can watch the image and keep out of the range once you learn it a bit.

It's kind of like that squishy who walks up to Leblanc's distortion pad, only to have her return to it and one shot him instantly.  You just have to pay attention.

i'm not having any issues playing agaisnt ekkos, i just feel bad for murdering people so easily
i mean situations like this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kbi7yCf1mjM
where ur taking down full hp champs in less that a second cant be good.  at least with the champs u mentions u can zhonyas the dmg, this is instant death

You're playing against people who aren't very good though. Better players will be able to track the ghost and even react to the actual activation of the ult in time.

> [{quoted}](name=Nasreth,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2015-05-29T13:02:24.787+0000)
>

> 
> {{champion:55}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:30}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:32}} 
> 
> This isn't some unique trait that *only* Ekko has.  Lots of champions have high teamfight AOE damage.  To hit people with his ult, Ekko is blowing his most reliable escape and putting himself in a very dangerous position.  I think it's a reasonable tradeoff, especially considering you can watch the image and keep out of the range once you learn it a bit.
> 
> It's kind of like that squishy who walks up to Leblanc's distortion pad, only to have her return to it and one shot him instantly.  You just have to pay attention.

The problem is that its his entire kit NOT just his ult that's a huge threat. He has high damage poke as well as high damage ult and has utility. He's not just damage brand kat etc. He has hard cc AND UTILITY. Its just too much and it makes him overbearing.

There is significant difference between Ekko and those champions.  Each of those ults requires generally requires proper timing, proper setup, and also a noticeable time investment.

Examples

Katarina:  Channeled, easily interrupted, and can also be fairly easy to avoid with mobility skills.  Due to being channeled it is by nature a DoT thus allowing more time to react

Fiddlesticks:  Channeled, also easily interrupted, and _incredibly_ easy to avoid with proper vision coverage.  Acts as an AoE DoT which provides ample time to react

Karthus:  Channeled, and requires a hefty setup from his team.  Also generally requires Karthus to die so that he can actually safely cast it.  Provides a very clear particle effect as to when it is about to happening allowing a (fairly large) amount of time to react.

Rumble:  Requires very poor positioning on the enemy team (or very poor setting up on the enemy teams part, seriously stop trying to teamfight rumble in thing corridors like the jungle, **it never ends well**!).  Also functions as a DoT meaning that the enemy can avoid a significant portion of the damage if they position well enough.  In order to get quadras or pentas with this on your own you need to either be:  Grossly fed, or you enemy must be incredibly incompetent.

Yasuo:  Requires setup from either himself or allies, as his Q is fairly telegraphed and also fairly easy to avoid.  This means that you need at least 1 other person to be fairly skilled (that or the enemy team has to be _incredibly_ stupid and/or very poor at positioning).  Generally speaking Yasuo requires team assistance even after landing his ult as he can (unless very grossly fed) be destroyed fairly quickly and easily, even when moderately fed.

Amumu:  Well.......I have only seen a cheesey full AP amumu once (and I will admit, it was quite terrifying to deal with at times), but his ult generally isn't enough to secure him a quadra on his own (even when moderately fed).  And when I say on his own, I mean Amumu himself all alone and without team assistance.

Brand:  Requires incredibly poor positioning on the part of the enemy and brand generally isn't able to 100-0 an entire enemy team without allied assistance as he is both very fragile and very susceptible to cc due to his lack of mobility.  Unless the enemy team is composed of numbskulls he isn't going to be getting a solo quadra.

Fiora:  In my experience, every Fiora I have seen is downright abysmal unless she gets fed.  If she gets fed then her ult does have the potential to get a quadra, although generally this requires her to be grossly fed.  Also, the damage isn't entirely instant allowing for a period of time to react (even though it isn't a fairly large window), and also her penta potential requires on her enemies being fairly dumb.


Now then lets compare that to Ekko:

Ekko:  His ult is an _instant_ large AoE damage spike (and I do mean _very_ large AoE damage spike) that like many of the above champions rapidly scales up in damage if you get fed.  Now proper usage of his ult does require setup (generally in the form of wards, good prediction skills, and a fair amount of luck as you can never be 100% certain that the enemy will go in certain directions).  However, when it is properly set up, the event happens instantly and without warning.  You literally do not have a second to react before Ekko is just right there ripping anything and everything apart that was near the epicenter of his ultimate.  Now the important fact to remember that it isn't his ult alone that kills the enemies, it is also the way the rest of his kit works that gets involved too.  His W passive allows him to rapidly capitalize on the large burst from his ult (because if you are a squishy caught by his ult, and the ekko is moderately fed, you will be at roughly the 1/3rd HP mark during midgame), then he gets a huge shield and a stun field (which, while the stun field itself is difficult to use, the shield sure as hell isn't), and then his E which if used properly will allow him to avoid any incoming CC from the enemy(unless it is point and click CC of course), and then finally his Q and passive which both slow and will allow him to position himself incredibly quickly around the battle.


Now keep in mind, he does have to be moderately fed to 1v4, but in comparison to the above champions he is able to do it in a much much easier fashion than they could ever even hope to do (or, and this is the special mention to Yasuo, were also able to 1v4 in a similar manner but were nerfed to the ground because of it).  Hopefully they wont have to nerf Ekko too hard, but honestly he really does need some number nerfs.

I think they might be more successful in number tweaking Ekko than they were with Yasuo, largely because of the fact that one is an AP character and the other is a crit focused AD character (which seem to be very difficult for Riot to balance without simply making said champion useless).

>  Now proper usage of his ult does require setup (generally in the form of wards, good prediction skills, and a fair amount of luck as you can never be 100% certain that the enemy will go in certain directions).

So you need good vision, map awareness, skill on the champion, and some dumb luck to even make it work...   mmmm yeah seems OP.  Rito plz nerf :-/

All of the above champs require those things to be able to pull off a solo quadra (in the least, many of them require far more investment).  Personally I think Ekko's is a bit easier so I feel its nuke should be toned down some.

> [{quoted}](name=GeurillaKing,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-05-29T12:19:41.995+0000)
>
> so a 1 click quadra kill is fine then?

To be fair, they can SEE where your ult will be activated is so it is avoidable.
Most people will just run in circles in a fight, so no matter what you are in blast radius

Depends on if you can see where Ekko is, but yes generally you can see where his clone is during a fight.

I will admit though, keeping track of the non-distinct looking clone can be quite difficult in a fight (especially if there are a lot of AoE particle effects going on, such as Karthus's E which makes base skin Ekko's incredibly difficult to see)

> [{quoted}](name=GeurillaKing,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-05-29T12:19:41.995+0000)
>

Yep, because its insanely telegraphed.

Well i do want to agree with you but he just came out so you will be obliterating people and once people learn his kit and play style his ult can be very easily avoided because you just have to watch his following ghost.  I think his ult is meant to do that much damage because thino about it, his only damage ability is Q and his passive which only works once every X amount of time on the same target. Everything else just improves his fighting style. So he needs that ultimate damage to pull off his quick assassinations. He is kind of like talon AOE except he can stun/shield. Also ekko has no other valued strengths like splitpushing, wave clear etc. So in my opinion he is a fine champion. As time passes people will learn to counter. Although 120% ability power is insane so i might just tone that to 100%
Ekko has really solid (if not good) wave clear...

> [{quoted}](name=Retillin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=00010002,timestamp=2015-05-29T13:56:21.945+0000)
>
> Ekko has really solid (if not good) wave clear...

the return damage on his q after it passing through a minon wave is extremely good wave clear
Not true. His E has damage on the blink, and his W has a passive that gives him % missing health damage that scales with AP. Because his W needed to do something else, I guess.

> [{quoted}](name=BigDumbSmartGuy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-05-29T11:59:52.472+0000)
>
> Not true. His E has damage on the blink, and his W has a passive that gives him % missing health damage that scales with AP. Because his W needed to do something else, I guess.

The % missing health damage only applies to targets under 30% HP

Parallel Convergence [ W ]

Cooldown: 22/20/18/16/14 seconds || Mana Cost: 30/40/50/60/70

Passive: Ekko’s basic attacks deal bonus magic damage to enemies under 30% health, equal to 5% [ +1% per 45 AP ] of their missing health (capped at 400 damage vs. minions and monsters).

Active: Ekko opens a time rift, creating an alternate reality copy of him that tosses a device to a target location. After a delay, the device expands into a broad zone that slows enemies by 40%. If Ekko enters the sphere, it detonates, granting him a 150/195/240/285/330 (+ 0.8 AP) shield for 2 seconds and stunning all enemies inside for 2.25 seconds.

ekko has some pretty amazing wave clear, i usually play him top, and once i get my Ludens "Ekko" (see what i did there?) i can fire 1 q  and pretty much just last hit all the minions that dont die from that. in the game i showed here, i just did a bunch of roaming and got a tonne of kills  from it so got fed early, i mean thats fine since i managed to get myself fed, but in a different game, i didnt do so well, and the mid got hella fed, and i still managed to kill him. Admitedly i did outplay him pretty well though lol

Well I've been here since Jayce release and historically whenever champion was called "Balanced" at the release date - he would always turn out OP enough to get nerfed shortly after (sometimes even mutiple times).

Some examples:
{{champion:421}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:157}} 
(I would include Rengar too, but he actually got some bugs fixes first)

And hell, don't forget that there were champions that were called "Underpowered" by everyone and yet got nothing but nerfs in the end. Most recent example would be {{champion:150}} .

Generally it always have been like this (with new releases being underestimated), which leads to conclusion that learning a champion and its builds have bigger impact than learning how to deal with it.

Hell, even Bard is appreciated more and more as time progresses (though, he actually got some solid buffs) and he was considered a complete trash champion.

**Tl;dr: I can bet my ass off that Ekko will get solid nerfs as soon as playerbase will learn how to build and play him.**

> [{quoted}](name=LegitBacon66,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PeoXFxOT,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-29T11:57:45.975+0000)
>
> Well i do want to agree with you but he just came out so you will be obliterating people and once people learn his kit and play style his ult can be very easily avoided because you just have to watch his following ghost.  I think his ult is meant to do that much damage because thino about it, his only damage ability is Q and his passive which only works once every X amount of time on the same target. Everything else just improves his fighting style. So he needs that ultimate damage to pull off his quick assassinations. He is kind of like talon AOE except he can stun/shield. Also ekko has no other valued strengths like splitpushing, wave clear etc. So in my opinion he is a fine champion. As time passes people will learn to counter. Although 120% ability power is insane so i might just tone that to 100%

One add on, Ekko is a GREAT split pusher. It's easy to build AS and MS, late game he can wave clear fine, and if he gets caught split pushing he will juke and bait you around the map (or just ulti to safety)

He has like, 2 ult-feeling abilities. 

His ult, and his damn W, while that one is way harder to use, the slow, really good stun, and a disgustingly powerful shield. That W seems better than some peoples ACTUAL ults.
His ult just needs to be removed in general. He can towerdive better than fucking Tryndamere.

It's telegraphed four seconds ahead of time in terms of positioning.

I wouldn't mind it being nerfed a bit, but it should deal enough damage to be respected. Are people just ignoring the ghost, are entire teams ignoring the thing?

Nah. It's just how big the radius is on the ghost. If Ekko has anyone even somewhat following him, if he can toss a Q to slow them, it's game over from a quick R that you can't see if you can't see Ekko or if you happen to be trying to push Ekko away, or heck, even if your enemy is getting a gank after you run in. Toss Q then press R and AA. You'll do 2.2x your AP without even taking into consideration the second hit from his Q. Q does .2 on hit and does one proc of his passive, his Ult does 1.3x his AP and applies his passive, then you AA for .7x your AP from the third hit passive. This combo is very, very easy to land.
bronze

Yeah, I don't know why they made such a high utility spell also do damage near equivalent to Tristana's troublesome R. It does 1.3x his AP. Trist's R is a 1.5x. Well, as we all know, an E and R was usually enough to kill a sqishy. If you Q the enemy team to slow them, then R into them for the maxed Q, passive, and R, you just did 2.8x your AP instantly. .7 on his passive, .8 on his Q (It's .2 for the toss, .6 for the return, so it is balanced properly for you to dodge it, still could use a tone down though), and a 1.3x on his R. It's WAY too high. A .8 woiuld've been enough for that R really.
It's almost impossible to pull off that combo however.

0.o A Q and R combo? His R may show where it's at, but if they give any kind of chase, all you have to do is toss the Q then press R. The explosion has a very big radius and the Q's large slow is more than enough to keep them from escaping the instantaneous R. Any ADC who wants to try to kill you can't, any melee who wants to kill you can't, anything that's not a beefy tank can't kill you as long as your very short CD R is up. Even without the second Q, you can easily get the first bit to get, R, then AA. That's still 2.2x your AP, which is the average AP's FULL combo. Like, completely full, not one and a half abilities. lol.
A single screenshot from Silver III where the Ahri was also wicked fed confirms it.

I think one of the biggest reasons it does so much damage is simple:

Your enemies CONSTANTLY have a 4 second warning that updates in real-time.

Yes, in a teamfight this can be a problem, but a teamfight isn't an excuse.  If you can't keep track of important things like that, you're shitty at teamfighting.
can we just delete him and replace him with ao shin

The Balance Team (Micky mouse voice): "Hiya folks, lets make our next champion have an AoE Veigar ult, haha. And lets make it heal and dodge abilities too, haha. We need to fuck balance just like we psychologically fuck kids for money with our sexual innuendos in every Disney movie, haha."

Oh wait micky mouse isn't on the balance team? Oh. Still relevant though right?

Let's nerf the people grouping around the afterimage with a glowing symbol above it, then regroup and see if the damage still needs to go down. The damage is actually there partially to keep people from "camping" the afterimage, so it has to have a reasonable threat level.

However, just for reference, I'd like anyone doubting in the slightest that Ekko's ult does a button of damage to go ahead and compare his numbers with Malzahar's ult.

Damned if you do, damned if you dont scenario

Let's say you do go straight for him and try force him to use the ult quickly...
if youre lucky and quick enough it will detonate far enough away to not nuke your whole team, 
but even then how are you supposed to deal with the 4 other people on the team while forcing it out of him

OR

it does hit you, you all wipe guaranteed

OR 

you dont focus Ekko, his other ridiculous scalings just light your team up and he runs around in circles and ults any way, leading to scenario 2

the way how i view ekkos is like the way i view fizz. They are both assassins, which means they should have a high damage output. I think this champ is fine how it is just ppl dont know how to play against him yet.
Vel'koz's ult does more damage, is ranged and requires less set up. No one complains about it.
Thats probably because the damage is done over a few seconds rather than immediately
how do u get s+ and win and only get 275 points
the 275 is from the S+, but there are more points from winning and playing. When you hover over your ranking, it shows what part of the points came from it.
